name: XENPOZYME

indications.text: xenpozyme indicated treatment non–central nervous system manifestations acid sphingomyelinase deficiency ( ASM-deficient Niemann-Pick disease ) adult pediatric patients .

contraindications.text: full prescribing information important recommendations prior xenpozyme treatment initiation . ( 2.1 ) adults : recommended starting dose 0.1 mg/kg administered intravenous infusion . ( 2.2 ) pediatrics : recommended starting dose 0.03 mg/kg administered intravenous infusion . ( 2.3 ) full prescribing information recommended dose escalation maintenance , modifications reduce risk , preparation instructions . ( 2.2 , 2.3 , 2.5 , 2.6 , 2.7 )

indications_original: XENPOZYME is indicated for treatment of non–central nervous system manifestations of acid sphingomyelinase deficiency (ASMD) in adult and pediatric patients.
contraindications_original: See Full Prescribing Information for important recommendations prior to XENPOZYME treatment initiation. ( 2.1 ) Adults: Recommended starting dose is 0.1 mg/kg administered as an intravenous infusion. ( 2.2 ) Pediatrics: Recommended starting dose is 0.03 mg/kg administered as an intravenous infusion. ( 2.3 ) See Full Prescribing Information for the recommended dose escalation and maintenance dosage, dosage modifications to reduce the risk of adverse reactions, and preparation and administration instructions. ( 2.2 , 2.3 , 2.5 , 2.6 , 2.7 )
